page: Risk management strategies and process questions
label: Please provide the names, locations, and services provided by all 3rd and 4th parties you use to support the products/services provided to Candescent.
Do you have a formal identity and access management program?
If yes, does your IAM support automated workflows for access management provisioning and de-provisioning?
Does your IAM support MFA for enhanced user authentication to access internal systems?
Do you have a clearly defined policy for managing access, including provisioning, de-provisioning, and regular reviews of user access levels and permissions? (This includes physical assets as well.)
Do you maintain a list of all privileged accounts and do you audit the use of those accounts?
Do employees with privileged account permissions receive additional cybersecurity training commensurate with their levels of responsibility?
Are data classification labels used in your role based access control?
Do you maintain the principle of least privilege when granting logical access to systems, data or resources for both your employees and subcontractors?
Do you track and audit third party or contractor accounts that have access to your system?
Is access terminated for third party or contractor relationships the same day the relationship is ended?
Are vendor supplied default configurations (including usernames and passwords) changed, and/or disabled before use in production environments?
Are staff able to access client data in an unencrypted state?
Do access control requests require manager approvals?
Do you encrypt the data you collect and store from Candescent?
Do you have data owner and data custodian roles defined and assigned to your data?
Do you encrypt all sensitive data at rest?
Do you have a data handling policy for the data you receive from Candescent which includes data collection, retention and destruction?
Do you have a data classification and labeling scheme as part of your Security Program?
Do you have a centralized encryption key management system?
Do you maintain and audit a list of authorized users with access to encryption keys?
Do all of your laptops with access to sensitive data have full disk encryption enabled?
Do you deploy MDM on the devices that may have access to corporate data?
Do you use publicly available object storage technologies such as AWS S3 to store customer data?
If yes, is Candescent data stored in a single or multi-tenant environment?
Please describe the moments you take to ensure the data is not publicly accessible?
Do you/your vendor maintain the principle of least privilege when granting physical access to corporate resources, including data center(s)?

Do you/your vendor have procedural and technical controls such as badge readers, security cameras, biometric identification devices, etc. to control physical access of persons to corporate IT resources, including data centers?
Do you/your vendor maintain access logs from badge readers, security cameras, biometric identification devices, etc?
Are access logs from badge readers, security cameras, biometric identification devices, etc. maintained at least 6 months?
If not, please clarify how long they are maintained.
Do you/your vendor conduct periodic access reviews to ensure that only people with the appropriate roles and permissions are accessing your corporate resources, including data centers?
If you provide a hosted service, please provide the location(s) (city and state, or region/country) from which that hosted service is running.
Does your organization have the capability to detect unauthorized changes to your systems?
Do you have the capability to define normal baseline events as well as the capability to detect and identify any deviations from normal?
Network events?
Security events?
Application events?
Infrastructure services?
Do you have a SIEM?
Do you monitor your own cybersecurity risk based on external cybersecurity vendor reports such as BitSight, RiskRecon, etc.
Do you have staff that can review security event data and drive actions based on that data?
Do you have comprehensive policies for Logging?
Do you have comprehensive policies for Log management?
Is multi-factor authentication used when connecting to VPN, cloud interfaces (AWS, Azure, etc.) and/or other critical infrastructure systems?
Does your organization have a formal Information security incident management process?
Do you have the appropriate processes and procedures to deal with Security threats that affect your services?
Is there a 24/7 security incident response team with clearly defined and documented roles and responsibilities?
Do you have adequate cyber insurance to cover damages resulting from critical security incidents?
Do you test your response policies/plans at least annually?
Do you have the appropriate processes and procedures to deal with Systems failures that affect your services?
Do you have the appropriate processes and procedures to deal with Data integrity issues that affect your services?
Is there a predefined plan for handling incidents, involving data exposure or violations to data privacy laws?
Are you prepared to handle incidents that are a result of emerging technologies (deep fakes, supply chain attacks, etc.)?
Do you have a ransomware playbook?
If yes, do you test & update this playbook at least annually?
As part of your ransomware playbook, have you evaluated whether or not your organization will pay ransom in the event of a critical ransomware attack? (Note: we're not asking what that decision is.)
Do you have enough coverage in your cyber insurance to meet your RTO/RPO commitments in the event of a catastrophic ransomware event?
Do you have a 3-2-1 backup strategy to meet your RTO/RPO commitments in the event of a catastrophic ransomware event?
How do you maintain integrity of your infrastructure in the event of a ransomware attack if your data is constantly replicated and there is no snapshot of your data offsite?
Do you have real-time ransomware detection capabilities?

form block title: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Questions
label: Do you maintain a copy of your production data at another physical or logical location?
Are your networks segmented according to function, purpose, and security classification?
Do you have a restricted management network for the management of your information systems?
Do you require VPN access to touch your data center management resources?
If yes, how do you connect to your data center management resources?
Do you have a firewall rule management system which allows for tracking and auditing all firewall rules through their lifecycle?
Do you audit the accuracy of your Firewall rules at least annually?
Do you control egress network traffic from your user networks?
Do you control egress network traffic from your data center networks?
Do you have web content filtering policies implemented for your User networks?
Do you have web content filtering policies implemented for your Data Center networks?
Do you have SSL decryption and inspection capabilities for Ingress Network traffic?
Do you have SSL decryption and inspection capabilities for Egress Network traffic?
Do you have SSL decryption and inspection capabilities for User Network traffic?
Do you have SSL decryption and inspection capabilities for Server Network traffic?
Do you have malware detection/blocking capabilities on Endpoint devices?
Do you have malware detection/blocking capabilities on the Network core?
Do you have malware detection/blocking capabilities on the Network Edge?
Do you use DNS malware filtering/sinkhole services?
Do you have a vulnerability management program?
Does 100% of your overall environment get scanned for vulnerabilities?
Do you patch your Desktop estate at least monthly?
Do you patch your Production systems, servers, etc. at least monthly?
Do you have a regular patching cycle for systems, servers, etc. for Non-prod?
How quickly do you patch critical vulnerabilities which are outside your normal patch deployment cycle?
Do your users have local administrative rights on the corporate IT Desktop systems?
Is 100% of your desktop and data center systems have anti-virus software installed and functioning?
Do you have centralized management alerting and reporting for your anti-malware systems?
Do you have IDS/IPS capabilities on your End node devices?
Do you have IDS/IPS capabilities at your Network core?
Do you have IDS/IPS capabilities at your Network Edge?
Do you have third party connections to your network?
Are these third-party network connections monitored for security events?
Are these third-party network connections verified and reviewed periodically?
Do you offer wireless access to employees and guests?
If yes, are these networks segregated and require secure access?
If yes, please provide the type of wireless connection encryption used (WEP, WPA, etc.).
Do you have CIS, NIST or SANS or any other system hardening baselines, implemented?
Do you use automation tools for system deployment?
Are your system hardening baselines deployed at system initiation and maintained throughout its life cycle?
Do you have a system to detect sensitive data at rest in unauthorized locations?
Do you have a system to detect the transmission through email of unprotected sensitive data?
Do you have a system to detect the transmission through the network of unprotected sensitive data?
Do you have a process for correcting the root cause for any unprotected, sensitive data detected through your DLP/unauthorized data & oceans scans?
Does your security awareness training cover the proper use, storage, and transmission of sensitive data?
Does company provide computer equipment for employees working 100% remote?
Are these devices secured in the same fashion as the devices of employees working at the office, in with content filtering, email security etc.?
Do you practice the principle of least privilege when granting user access to the Internet while working remotely?
Do you incorporate an industry standard SDLC Model for software development?
If you are using a secure Software Development Framework (SSDF), what standard is it based on?
If you are not using a SSDF, do you have plans to do so in the future, and when?
Does your organization utilize OWASP Top 10 development practices?
If not, what application security standard do you use?
Do you review security at each phase of the software development lifecycle?
Do you perform static and/or dynamic source code analysis as part of your SDLC development/release cycle?
Are vulnerabilities identified through static/dynamic code analysis remediated before implementing newly developed or changed applications into production?
Is source code actively scanned using automated tools in the development environment and so that security vulnerabilities can be resolved during each phase of the SDLC?

Is the security of applications, including Web-based applications connected to the internet, tested against known types of cyber attacks (e.g., SQL injection, cross-site scripting, buffer overflows) before implementation or following significant changes?
Do you use open source/closed source 3rd party, libraries?
If yes, do you scan for vulnerabilities?
If yes, how do you ensure the code you're using is secure?
Do you complete quality assurance to test third-party code you use?
Do third parties conduct security assessments on your products?
Do your development and testing teams undergo regular security training?
Is your source code, executables and scripts digitally signed to confirm the software author and guarantee that the code has not been altered or corrupted?
Is source code, executables and scripts of your 3rd parties digitally signed to confirm the software author and guarantee that the code has not been altered or corrupted?
Is the product you provide to Candescent subject to sanctions by the Office of Foreign Assets Control?

If yes, please explain how do you meet those requirements/what program do you have in place, whether or not you've had any violations, and if there have been any violations have they been resolved or is there a remediation plan.
Have you had any violations or regulatory actions with applicable supervisory agencies and/or regulatory organizations?
If yes, please explain what it was, when it was remediated.
Are you subject to GLBA?
If Yes, have you had a GLBA audit? (Please provide the results)
Is the product you provide to Candescent required to comply with the Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML)? Same as the first one.

If yes, please explain how do you meet those requirements/what program do you have in place, whether or not you've had any violations, and if there have been any violations have they been resolved or is there a remediation plan.
Do you use any artificial intelligence (including machine learning, generative AI, or BOT) technologies to produce or deliver products or services to Candescent?
Do you have a formal policy governing usage of AI?
Does the AI have access to confidential Candescent?
Are you using public or shared AI technology to process confidential information?
Do you have any end of life technology (e.g., Windows 2003, Windows 2008) that are used to provide services to Candescent?
